dataset.title: Stream chemistry along a latitude gradient, 2009

address.deliveryPoint: Institute of Arctic Biology, 902 N Koyukuk Ave.
Institute of Arctic Biology; Department of Biology and Wildlife; University of Alaska Fairbanks

abstract.para: This dataset contains concentrations of major anions, cations, dissolved organic carbon and nitrogen for streams along a latitude gradient from interior Alaska to the North Slope of the Brooks Range. Values of water isotopes and isotopes of nitrate, stream temperature, specific conductivity, and pH are also included. Samples were collected in May, July, and August of 2009.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: Experimental Design
section.para: 24 streams were selected spanning a gradient from boreal to arctic Alaska. Most sampling was conducted where streams intersected the Dalton Highway. All streams are spring or groundwater fed, except the Tanana and Middle Fork Koyukuk, which are glacier fed, and the Yukon, which has both glacial and spring fed tributaries. Sampling was conducted during snowmelt, and twice in summer to capture seasonal patterns.

section.title: Methods
section.para: FIELD: Specific conductance, temperature, and pH were measured in the field using a handheld meter (YSI). All samples for analysis of dissolved constituents were filtered in the field (0.7 uM) For solute concentrations, triplicate water samples were collected and transported to the laboratory on ice, then frozen. Single samples were collected for nitrate isotopes and water isotopes. Samples for analysis of water isotopes were collected without headspace, sealed in gas-tight vials, and refrigerated. LAB: Anion and cation concentrations were analyzed on an ion chromatograph (Dionex IC25). Total organic carbon was measured as non-purgeable organic carbon on via non-dispersive infrared gas analysis (Shimadzu TOC-5000), and total dissolved nitrogen was measured using an Antek module. Water isotopes were measured via cavity ring-down spectroscopy (Picarro). All of the above analyses were completed at UAF. Isotopes of nitrate were measured via mass spectrometry following the denitrifier procedure at the Stable Isotope Facility, University of California-Davis.
